fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Class AbstractDataTwoWayPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractTwoWayPort<DataTwoWayCI>
                • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractDataTwoWayPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentInterface, DataTwoWayCI, OfferedCI, RequiredCI, TwoWayCI, InboundPortI, OutboundPortI, PortI, TwoWayPortI<DataTwoWayCI>, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PingPongDataTwoWayPort

    public abstract class AbstractDataTwoWayPort
extends AbstractTwoWayPort<DataTwoWayCI>
implements DataTwoWayCI
    The class AbstractDataTwoWayPort partially implements a data two-way port for components exchanging data with each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.

    Description

    Strictly speaking, the class is not abstract. But the method send (resp. request) is used both to send (respectively request) data to (resp. from) the other component and to receive (respectively serve the request for) data from the other component. As in this case, the port must pass (respectively request) the data to its owner component, it must know what method of its owner component to call, a knowledge that depends upon the application component, so the two methods must be extended in an application-specific port to that end.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

                              java.lang.String executorServiceURI)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        create and initialise data two-way ports, with a given URI.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null && uri != null
 post    !isDestroyed()
 post    getPortURI().equals(uri)
 post    getOwner().equals(owner)
 post    !connected()
 post  !isRemotelyConnected()
 post    owner.isPortExisting(uri)
 post    getImplementedInterface().equals(implementedInterface)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the port.
        implementedInterface - interface implemented by this port.
        owner - component that owns this port.
        pluginURI - URI of the plug-in to be called in the owner or null if none.
        executorServiceURI - URI of the executor service to be used to execute the service on the component or null if none.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
